messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2080
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/29/02 6:56:00 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/29/02 6:56:00 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I guess my question for you all is how you can be sure you aren't
steering when you mean to be strewing? Do you make sure your kids
don't get so caught up in on thing that they never experience any
others? How? >>

Because it's simply there, available. It matters not one whit if they use it
or not, it's just THERE.
My kids are intelligent, thoughtful, articulate human beings that are very
capable of making choices and would never be so totally wishy, washy as to do
something endlessly that they didn't LOVE. They also love trying new things
ALL the time, there is NO danger of my strewing becoming a guiding force.
Ren
